    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        public static Reference lookup(Repository repo,
                               String name)
        Lookup a reference by name in a repository.

        The name will be checked for validity. See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository to look up the reference
        name - the long name for the reference (e.g. HEAD, refs/heads/master, refs/tags/v0.1.0, ...)
        Returns:
        found reference, if not found, return null.
        Throws:
        GitException - GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or other relevant git errors.

      • nameToId

        public static Oid nameToId(Repository repo,
                           String name)
        Lookup a reference by name and resolve immediately to OID.

        This function provides a quick way to resolve a reference name straight through to the object id that it refers to. This avoids having to allocate or free any `git_reference` objects for simple situations.

        The name will be checked for validity. See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

        Parameters:
        repo - The repository in which to look up the reference
        name - The long name for the reference (e.g. HEAD, refs/heads/master, refs/tags/v0.1.0, ...)
        Returns:
        found Oid
        Throws:
        GitException - GIT_ENOTFOUND, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code.

      • dwim

        public static Reference dwim(Repository repo,
                             String shorthand)
        Do What I Mean (dwim). Lookup a reference by DWIMing its short name. For example dwim can find reference given name like "feature/dev", but look only understands "refs/heads/feature/dev"

        Apply the git precedences rules to the given shorthand to determine which reference the user is referring to.

        Parameters:
        repo - the repository in which to look
        shorthand - the short name for the reference
        Returns:
        found reference
        Throws:
        GitException

      • symbolicCreateMatching

        public static Reference symbolicCreateMatching(Repository repo,
                                               String name,
                                               String target,
                                               boolean force,
                                               String currentValue,
                                               String logMessage)
        Create a symbolic reference that points to another reference (target reference) and matches the currentValue when updating.

        For example, creating a soft ref pointing to "refs/heads/master": symbolicCreateMatching(repo, "HEAD", "refs/heads/master", false, null, null);

        For atomicity concern, enxure the target ref is not moved: symbolicCreateMatching(repo, "HEAD", "refs/heads/master", false, "refs/heads/master", null);

        To view/find symbolic refs:

      • ls -l .git/
      • git rev-parse <symbolic refname>
      • git symbolic ref ...
Parameters:
repo - Repository where the target reference and the symbolic reference live
name - name of the symbolic reference
target - name of the target reference
force - Overwrite if reference already exist
currentValue - The expected name of the reference when updating
logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
Returns:
0 on success
Throws:
GitException - GIT_EEXISTS, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC, GIT_EMODIFIED or an error code

  • symbolicCreate

    public static Reference symbolicCreate(Repository repo,
                                       String name,
                                       String target,
                                       boolean force,
                                       String logMessage)
    Create a new symbolic reference.
    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where that reference will live
    name - The name of the reference
    target - The target of the reference
    force - Overwrite existing references
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    created reference
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EEXISTS, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code

    public static Reference create(Repository repo,
                               String name,
                               Oid oid,
                               boolean force,
                               String logMessage)
    Create a new direct reference that refers directly to an Oid.
    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where that reference will live
    name - The name of the reference
    oid - The object id pointed to by the reference.
    force - Overwrite existing references
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    created reference.
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EEXISTS, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code

  • createMatching

    public static Reference createMatching(Repository repo,
                                       String name,
                                       Oid oid,
                                       boolean force,
                                       Oid currentId,
                                       String logMessage)
    Conditionally create new direct reference Note: this methods is untested, use with caution (you are welcome to contribute a test here).
    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where that reference will live
    name - The name of the reference
    oid - The object id pointed to by the reference.
    force - Overwrite existing references
    currentId - The expected value of the reference at the time of update
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    created reference.
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EMODIFIED if the value of the reference has changed, GIT_EEXISTS, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code

  • delete

    public static void delete(Reference ref)
    Delete an existing reference.

    This method works for both direct and symbolic references. The reference will be immediately removed on disk but the memory will not be freed. Callers must call `git_reference_free`.

    This function will return an error if the reference has changed from the time it was looked up.

    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EMODIFIED or an error code

  • remove

    public static void remove(Repository repo,
                          String name)
    Delete an existing reference by name

    This method removes the named reference from the repository without looking at its old value.

    Parameters:
    repo - repository where the reference lives
    name - The reference to remove
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • list

    public static List<String> list(Repository repo)
    Fill a list with all the references that can be found in a repository.

    The string array will be filled with the names of all references; these values are owned by the user and should be free'd manually when no longer needed, using `git_strarray_free()`.

    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where to find the refs
    Returns:
    list of reference names
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • foreach

    public static void foreach(Repository repo,
                           Function<Reference,Integer> callback)
    Perform a callback on each reference in the repository.

    The `callback` function will be called for each reference in the repository, receiving the reference object and the `payload` value passed to this method. Returning a non-zero value from the callback will terminate the iteration.

    Note that the callback function is responsible to call `git_reference_free` on each reference passed to it.

    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where to find the refs
    callback - Function which will be called for every listed ref, return non-zero to terminate the iteration.
    Throws:
    GitException - git errors

  • foreachName

    public static void foreachName(Repository repo,
                               Function<String,Integer> callback)
    Perform a callback on the fully-qualified name of each reference.

    The `callback` function will be called for each reference in the repository, receiving the name of the reference and the `payload` value passed to this method. Returning a non-zero value from the callback will terminate the iteration.

    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where to find the refs
    callback - Function which will be called for every listed ref name
    Throws:
    GitException - git errors

                      Reference ref2)

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    next reference, null GIT_ITEROVER if there are no more;
    Throws:

  • foreachGlob

    public static void foreachGlob(Repository repo,
                               String glob,
                               Reference.ForeachNameCb callback)
    Perform a callback on each reference in the repository whose name matches the given pattern.

    This function acts like `git_reference_foreach()` with an additional pattern match being applied to the reference name before issuing the callback function. See that function for more information.

    The pattern is matched using fnmatch or "glob" style where a '*' matches any sequence of letters, a '?' matches any letter, and square brackets can be used to define character ranges (such as "[0-9]" for digits).

    Parameters:
    repo - Repository where to find the refs
    glob - Pattern to match (fnmatch-style) against reference name.
    callback - Function which will be called for every listed ref
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EUSER on non-zero callback, or error code

  • hasLog

    public static boolean hasLog(Repository repo,
                             String refname)
    Check if a reflog exists for the specified reference. Same as cli: git reflog exists refs/heads/master
    Parameters:
    repo - the repository
    refname - the reference's name
    Returns:
    true if reflog exists
    Throws:
    GitException - git errors

  • ensureLog

    public static void ensureLog(Repository repo,
                             String refname)
    Ensure there is a reflog for a particular reference.

    Make sure that successive updates to the reference will append to its log.

    Parameters:
    repo - the repository
    refname - the reference's name
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • normalizeName

    public static String normalizeName(String name,
                                   EnumSet<Reference.Format> flags)
    Normalize reference name and check validity. See also git check-ref-format [--normalize]

    This will normalize the reference name by removing any leading slash '/' characters and collapsing runs of adjacent slashes between name components into a single slash.

    Once normalized, if the reference name is valid, it will be returned in the user allocated buffer.

    See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

    Parameters:
    name - Reference name to be checked.
    flags - Flags to constrain name validation rules - see the GIT_REFERENCE_FORMAT constants above.
    Returns:
    normalized name
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EBUFS if buffer is too small, GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code.

  • isValidName

    public static boolean isValidName(String refname)
    Ensure the reference name is well-formed.

    Valid reference names must follow one of two patterns:

    1. Top-level names must contain only capital letters and underscores, and must begin and end with a letter. (e.g. "HEAD", "ORIG_HEAD"). 2. Names prefixed with "refs/" can be almost anything. You must avoid the characters '~', '^', ':', '\\', '?', '[', and '*', and the sequences ".." and "@{" which have special meaning to revparse.

    Parameters:
    refname - name to be checked.
    Returns:
    1 if the reference name is acceptable; 0 if it isn't
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • targetPeel

    public Oid targetPeel()
    Return the peeled OID target of this reference.

    This peeled OID only applies to direct references that point to a hard Tag object: it is the result of peeling such Tag.

    Returns:
    peeled Oid or null

  • symbolicTarget

    public String symbolicTarget()
    Get full name to the reference pointed to by a symbolic reference.

    Only available if the reference is symbolic.

    Returns:
    name of the reference

  • type

    public Reference.ReferenceType type()
    Get the type of a reference.

    Either direct (GIT_REFERENCE_DIRECT) or symbolic (GIT_REFERENCE_SYMBOLIC)

    Returns:
    the type

  • name

    public String name()
    Get the full name of a reference.

    See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

    Returns:
    the full name for the ref

  • resolve

    public Reference resolve()
    Resolve a symbolic reference to a direct reference.

    This method iteratively peels a symbolic reference until it resolves to a direct reference to an OID.

    The peeled reference is returned in the `resolved_ref` argument, and must be freed manually once it's no longer needed.

    If a direct reference is passed as an argument, a copy of that reference is returned. This copy must be manually freed too.

    Returns:
    resolved reference
    Throws:
    GitException - resolve attempt failed

  • owner

    public Repository owner()
    Get the repository where a reference resides.
    Returns:
    owner repository

  • symbolicSetTarget

    public Reference symbolicSetTarget(String target,
                                   String logMessage)
    Create a new reference with the same name as the given reference but a different symbolic target. The reference must be a symbolic reference, otherwise this will fail.

    The new reference will be written to disk, overwriting the given reference.

    The target name will be checked for validity. See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

    The message for the reflog will be ignored if the reference does not belong in the standard set (HEAD, branches and remote-tracking branches) and and it does not have a reflog.

    Parameters:
    target - The new target for the reference
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    newly created Reference
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EINVALIDSPEC or an error code

  • setTarget

    public Reference setTarget(Oid oid,
                           String logMessage)
    Conditionally create a new reference with the same name as the given reference but a different OID target. The reference must be a direct reference, otherwise this will fail.

    The new reference will be written to disk, overwriting the given reference.

    Parameters:
    oid - The new target OID for the reference
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    newly created Reference
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EMODIFIED if the value of the reference has changed since it was read, or an error code

  • rename

    public Reference rename(String newName,
                        boolean force,
                        String logMessage)
    Rename an existing reference.

    This method works for both direct and symbolic references.

    The new name will be checked for validity. See `git_reference_symbolic_create()` for rules about valid names.

    If the `force` flag is not enabled, and there's already a reference with the given name, the renaming will fail.

    IMPORTANT: The user needs to write a proper reflog entry if the reflog is enabled for the repository. We only rename the reflog if it exists.

    Parameters:
    newName - The new name for the reference
    force - Overwrite an existing reference
    logMessage - The one line long message to be appended to the reflog
    Returns:
    new reference
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EINVALIDSPEC, GIT_EEXISTS or an error code

  • dup

    public Reference dup()
    Create a copy of an existing reference.

    Call `git_reference_free` to free the data.

    Returns:
    0 or an error code

  • iteratorNew

    public static Reference.Iterator iteratorNew(Repository repo)
    Create an iterator for the repo's references
    Parameters:
    repo - the repository
    Returns:
    newly constructed iterator
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • nextName

    public static String nextName(Reference.Iterator iterator)
    Get the next reference's name

    This function is provided for convenience in case only the names are interesting as it avoids the allocation of the `git_reference` object which `git_reference_next()` needs.

    Returns:
    name of the next reference, null there are no more (GIT_ITEROVER).
    Throws:
    GitException - git error

  • isBranch

    public boolean isBranch()
    Check if a reference is a local branch.
    Returns:
    true if the reference lives in the refs/heads namespace;

  • isRemote

    public boolean isRemote()
    Check if a reference is a remote tracking branch
    Returns:
    true when the reference lives in the refs/remotes namespace;

  • isTag

    public boolean isTag()
    Check if a reference is a tag
    Returns:
    1 when the reference lives in the refs/tags namespace;

  • isNote

    public boolean isNote()
    Check if a reference is a note
    Returns:
    1 when the reference lives in the refs/notes namespace;

  • peel

    public GitObject peel(GitObject.Type objType)
    Recursively peel reference until object of the specified type is found.

    The retrieved `peeled` object is owned by the repository and should be closed with the `git_object_free` method.

    If you pass `GIT_OBJECT_ANY` as the target type, then the object will be peeled until a non-tag object is met.

    Parameters:
    objType - The type of the requested object (GIT_OBJECT_COMMIT, GIT_OBJECT_TAG, GIT_OBJECT_TREE, GIT_OBJECT_BLOB or GIT_OBJECT_ANY).
    Returns:
    GitObject on success, null if not found
    Throws:
    GitException - GIT_EAMBIGUOUS or an error code

  • shorthand

    public String shorthand()
    Get the reference's short name

    This will transform the reference name into a name "human-readable" version. If no shortname is appropriate, it will return the full name.

    The memory is owned by the reference and must not be freed.

    Returns:
    the human-readable version of the name

  • target

    public Oid target()
    Get the OID pointed to by a direct reference.

    Only available if the reference is direct (i.e. an object id reference, not a symbolic one).

    To find the OID of a symbolic ref, call `git_reference_resolve()` and then this function (or maybe use `git_reference_name_to_id()` to directly resolve a reference name all the way through to an OID).

    Returns:
    a pointer to the oid if available, NULL otherwise

  • id

    public Oid id()
    Returns:
    target of this reference.
